ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Connection_zone_map_identification specifies the geometric, causal, relationship between a reference associated with a and a mapped associated with a template interface terminal.
the mapped_connection_zone_shape specifies the for the Connection_zone_map_identification.
the reference_connection_zone_shape specifies the for the Connection_zone_map_identification.

This relationship positions and orients the geometric model of a into the model of feature using a transformation. The interpretation of the associated_connection_zone_shape_definition shall be that it shall be a for the in the role of associated_usage.

the associated_usage_placement specifies the that is the target in the coordinate system of the model for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship, including any transformation required.
the associated_connection_zone_shape_definition specifies the that is the source shape for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship.
the associated_usage specifies the that is the target item for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship.
the associating_terminal_shape specifies the that is the model shape for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship.
A Part_feature_template_shape_definition is a type of . A Part_feature_template_shape_definition is the planar shape of a .
the shape_characterized_template specifies the role of the for the Part_feature_template_shape_definition.

ext_description.p: A Part_feature_template_definition is a type of . A Part_feature_template_definition is a template for one or more feature of one or more part. A Part_feature_template_definition may be used where classification of lead shape for parts is needed. The properties are provided by the Product_related_product_category on the Application Object referenced by the supertype. The model provides an abstract model of the template. The bound_parameters binds the Analytical_model_parameters to the Category_model_parameters so that An may be provided to represent the functional relationship between the Category_model_parameters. The shall be classified as a template model.
ext_description.example: A "J lead" Packaged_terminal may be defined once using Part_feature_template_definition and re-used many times.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_feature_template_definition is dependent on the existence of a that specifies the Part_feature_template_definition as its .

the bound_parameters specifies the role of the for the Part_feature_template_definition. There shall be one or more for a bound_parameters. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified. The bound_parameters specifies that each is specifying a pair of exactly equivalent . A receiver shall interpret this application of by applying a value to both parameters by application of the referenced by the model_parameter_assignment atttribute of model. The bound_parameters may be considered to be a mechanism to assign a mathematical relationship between the Category_model_parameters.

ext_description.note: The text description is out of date (Inverses...)...
ext_description.p: A Part_usage_view is a type of . Each Part_usage_view may be one of an , a , a , an , a , or a . A Part_usage_view identifies a as a part in its next assembly with sufficient detail to allow its use but without sufficient detail to permit reproduction of the . The product version referenced by the version attribute inherited from need not reference the same product version referenced by the design view. Support is provided for explicitly modeling connectors to be represented in the usage view so as to take advantage of common geometric modeling patterns including explicit placement.
ext_description.note: The product information necessary for a Part_usage_view is much less than that necessary to design, manufacture, or verify its performance from first principles. Terminals are defined only in the usage view of an item in this part of ISO 10303.
WR1 inherited from the supertype permits only to be associated as a component in a Part_usage_view, and then only in the and .

The usage view and design view of product contain similar concepts. It is the responsibility of the design organization to create the mapping between the usage view and the design view. As the design evolves to meet the requirements, the design view will reference different versions than the usage view.

The usage view and design view of product may have two instances of a connector with perhaps differing levels of detail. In this case, the design organization may wish to keep track of the relationship between the connector in the usage view and the connector in the design view by populating a member of for each connector in the usage view. It is the responsibility of the design organization to create the mapping between the usage view and the design view. As the design evolves to meet the requirements, the design view will reference different product versions than the usage view than the usage view does.

In a drawing based exchange, an interface control drawing would contain the same information found in a usage view. Industry standards describing the information represented by interface control drawings could migrate to computer interpetable standards exchange using this standard.
ext_description.example: Examples of information provided in a usage view include outline shape, functional block diagram, simplified connector models and location and orientation of those models, terminal identification, package orientation features, mounting features, interface models, pin mapping.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Part_feature_make_from_relationship associates two , one of which has been reused from an existing made from part.
the resultant_feature specifies a for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.
the reusable_feature specifies a for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.
the associated_make_from specifies an for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.

ext_description.p: A Part_feature is a type of . A Part_feature may be an , or additionally may be one of a , a , a , or a or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be one of a or a , or additionally may be an , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a , or additionally may be a .
ext_description.note: A Part_feature is a distinctive aspect of a that partially supports the choice of that in the design.

The design_view_definition_component_feature and design_view_definition_stratum_concept should only be populated for design archival and should not normally be publicly available as they allow queries against detailed design data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the feature_shape is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_feature is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Part_feature as its . There shall be zero or more for a Part_feature.
the precedent_feature specifies the role of the for the Part_feature. The precedent_feature need not be specified for a particular Part_feature.
the material_state_change specifies the for the Part_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
the associated_definition specifies the for the targeted Part_feature.
